answers.answer: The provided content lists various help-lines in Romania, including those for refugees, information about rights and services, anti-trafficking, border police, and domestic violence. Each help-line addresses specific needs.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/call-center and read the section under 'Help-lines:'.

answers.answer: Refugees can contact the Romanian government help-line by calling +40 213 456 789.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/call-center and read the section under 'Help-lines:'.

answers.answer: The Romanian government help-line is available Monday-Friday between 8:00 a.m. and 4:00 p.m.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/call-center and read the section under 'Help-lines:'.

answers.answer: The National Line against Trafficking in Persons Romania is established to address trafficking in persons.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/call-center and read the section under 'Help-lines:'.

answers.answer: The provided content only lists the contact number for the Romanian Red Cross (CRR) but does not describe its specific assistance methods.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/call-center and read the section under 'Help-lines:'.

answers.answer: The provided content only lists the contact number for UNHCR, the UN Refugee Agency, but does not specify the support it offers to refugees.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/call-center and read the section under 'Help-lines:'.

answers.answer: One can access medical support for HIV treatment or services by contacting Sens Pozitiv at +40 744 682 225.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/call-center and read the section under 'Medical support'.

answers.answer: Support and guidance for refugees suffering from rare diseases are available in Romania through The National Alliance for Rare Diseases Romania in collaboration with EURORDIS - Rare Diseases Europe.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/call-center and read the section under 'Medical support'.

answers.answer: Save the Children supports children from Ukraine by providing a free telephone line for counseling and offering guidance and information on their protection.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/call-center and read the section under 'Children support'.

answers.answer: Assistance for accommodation requests and information regarding conditions of stay on Romanian territory is available through the General Inspectorate for Immigration (Bucharest Directorate of Immigration) by calling 0214109940.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/call-center and read the section under 'Support for accommodation requests and information regarding the conditions of stay on the Romanian territory:'.

answers.answer: Citizens can contact Sibiu City Hall through its TelVerde, via the Social Assistance Department, by calling +40 800 811 822.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/call-center and read the section under 'Sibiu, Romania'.

answers.answer: In Timișoara, Romania, the Call center Timișoara City Hall operates as a help-line and can be reached at +40 356 993.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/call-center and read the section under 'Timișoara, Romania'.

answers.answer: Refugees can find support in the Republic of Moldova by contacting the Migration and Asylum Office within the Ministry of Interior at 080001527 or the Law Center of Moldova at +373 60574848.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/call-center and read the section under 'Republic of Moldova:'.

answers.answer: Information for refugees from Ukraine is available in Poland by calling +48 47 721 75 75.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/call-center and read the section under 'Poland'.

answers.answer: Ukrainian speakers can get help in Slovakia by calling the Ministry of the Interior hotlines at +421 513 816 111 or +421 259 765 111.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/call-center and read the section under 'Slovakia'.

answers.answer: The provided content lists the contact number and a website for the Czech Ministry of Interior help-line, but does not specify its operating hours.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/call-center and read the section under 'Czech Republic'.
